revised_title: Infrared Spectroscopic Studies of Adsorption on Alkali Halide Surfaces: Hydrogen Halides on Fluorides, Chlorides, Bromides, and Iodides
tldr: This study investigates the adsorption of hydrogen halides (HCl, HBr, and HI) on alkali halide surfaces using infrared spectroscopy. The research shows the presence of a dominant surface species involving hydrogen bonding between the hydrogen halide molecule and a surface anion. The findings reveal interesting differences in adsorption on fluoride surfaces compared to chloride to iodide surfaces, providing insights into the interactions between adsorbates and alkali halide surfaces.
